Muhammad Ali

About Me

Hello, I am a recent graduate based out of the Lower Mainland in British Columbia and am willing to relocate across Canada if offered the opportunity. I have a background in Web development and I also fiddle around with cloud/networking infrastructure, which explains my certification.

Aside: This website is hosted on AWS EC2 taking advantage of the Elastic Beanstalk configurations and PostgreSQL Relational Database Service (RDS). I have configured my own personal environment to make the compute engine more efficient and am currently avoiding adding a load balancer because of the added cost which is also why the RDS is attached to this applications instance instead of being on a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

Projects

Chrome Work Extension
It is a google chrome extension to increase productivity. The extension was originally approved for public publishing but due to security I will be loading it independently.
Simple Generator React App
This is a simple generator for use in creating passwords. It uses a RESTful (not RPC) API with Express.js and implements CRUD operations with PostgreSQL.
Ludo Game Web App
This project is a ES6 implementation of the 'Ludo' board game. It takes advantage of the native Canvas API offered by MDN. Additionally, it uses Asynchronous (AJAX) programming by handling promises given by functions that require an un-sequential (asynchronous) call.
Python Budget Calc.
This python implementation reads financial statements in the form of .csv and performs explanatory analysis. The GUI was incorporated through the Tkinter python package in addition to Numpy, Pandas, and Matplotlib.
CGR Independent Research
This is the independent research I conducted under the Center for Gambling Research at UBC. These python files are the statistical analysis I pursued. All of the work I contributed towards and the results are in a paper for which I have uploaded; the report was written in Latex.
Bash conf files/scripts
These are the configuration files for my personal linux machine running the i3 window manager. Some information is excluded because it is personal and not applicable to any other user.
